unnormalised: Property prices in Mumbai's posh Bandra area have skyrocketed, with reports indicating an avg. increase of 15% in the last qtr. A 2BHK flat near Linking Road is now fetching upwards of ₹5 crores, revealed a recent survey by real estate firm PropTrack. Property dealers are saying that NRI investments and increased demand from Bollywood celebs are driving the surge.
normalised: Property prices in Mumbai's posh Bandra area have skyrocketed, with reports indicating an average increase of fifteen percent in the last quarter. A two B-H-K flat near Linking Road is now fetching upwards of rupee five crores, revealed a recent survey by real estate firm PropTrack. Property dealers are saying that N-R-I investments and increased demand from Bollywood celebrities are driving the surge.

unnormalised: Anuj Sharma, a local broker, mentioned that a 3BHK apartment in Pali Hill recently sold for a whopping Rs 12.5 crore. Apparently, a known actor, whose name he couldn't disclose for privacy reasons, bagged the deal. The previous owner bought the same property just 3 years ago for Rs 8 crore, making a handsome profit in a pretty short time frame.
normalised: Anuj Sharma, a local broker, mentioned that a three B-H-K apartment in Pali Hill recently sold for a whopping rupees twelve point five crore. Apparently, a known actor, whose name he couldn't disclose for privacy reasons, bagged the deal. The previous owner bought the same property just three years ago for rupees eight crore, making a handsome profit in a pretty short time frame.

unnormalised: According to govt. figures, stamp duty collections in Maharashtra rose by 20% YoY, further indicating a boom in the real estate sector. Areas like Thane and Navi Mumbai are also experiencing steady growth, with 1BHK apartments seeing an appreciation of around 8%. This growth is fueled by the influx of young professionals working in the IT and financial sectors.
normalised: According to government figures, stamp duty collections in Maharashtra rose by twenty percent year over year, further indicating a boom in the real estate sector. Areas like Thane and Navi Mumbai are also experiencing steady growth, with one B-H-K apartments seeing an appreciation of around eight percent. This growth is fueled by the influx of young professionals working in the I-T and financial sectors.

unnormalised: However, some experts are cautioning against a possible bubble. They're pointing to the fact that interest rates are on the rise, and the affordability index has taken a dip. A report from HDFC Securities suggests that while demand is currently strong, it may not be sustainable in the long run if economic conditions worsen.
normalised: However, some experts are cautioning against a possible bubble. They are pointing to the fact that interest rates are on the rise, and the affordability index has taken a dip. A report from H-D-F-C Securities suggests that while demand is currently strong, it may not be sustainable in the long run if economic conditions worsen.

unnormalised: Rental yields, too, are showing interesting trends. While residential rents in South Mumbai remain high, commercial properties in areas like BKC are seeing a slight correction. Several large corporations are reportedly downsizing their office spaces, opting for hybrid work models, which is impacting rental income for landlords.
normalised: Rental yields, too, are showing interesting trends. While residential rents in South Mumbai remain high, commercial properties in areas like B-K-C are seeing a slight correction. Several large corporations are reportedly downsizing their office spaces, opting for hybrid work models, which is impacting rental income for landlords.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, real estate developers are launching new projects to capitalize on the boom. Godrej Properties recently announced a luxurious residential complex in Chembur with prices starting from Rs 3 crore. The project boasts of amenities like a swimming pool, gymnasium, and 24/7 security. Bookings are already underway, and the response has been quite encouraging, they claim.
normalised: Meanwhile, real estate developers are launching new projects to capitalize on the boom. Godrej Properties recently announced a luxurious residential complex in Chembur with prices starting from rupees three crore. The project boasts of amenities like a swimming pool, gymnasium, and twenty four seven security. Bookings are already underway, and the response has been quite encouraging, they claim.

unnormalised: The real estate market is a real rollercoaster, bhai! Whether it’s a good time to buy or sell depends on your risk appetite and financial goals. But one thing's for sure - the market is sizzling, and everyone wants a piece of the action. Property prices continue to be a major topic of discussion over chai time.
normalised: The real estate market is a real rollercoaster, bhai! Whether it is a good time to buy or sell depends on your risk appetite and financial goals. But one thing is for sure - the market is sizzling, and everyone wants a piece of the action. Property prices continue to be a major topic of discussion over chai time.
